chargeHist.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andy A Olivares was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Handgun-Alcohol Sold/Consumed, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.237(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1000.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit.
With credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencement until 10-23-15 .

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andy A Olivares

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andy A Olivares in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 10-23-15 .  

Fine of $1000.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Andy A Olivares in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On state's motion, Court ordered charge amended to CARRYING HANDGUN WHERE ALCOHOL BEVERAGES MAY BE SOLD AND CONSUMED PURSUANT TO WI. SEC 941.237(2) , class A misd.

 Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as to the amended charge in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Case passed.

15RM023796

Defendant Andy A Olivares in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No file in court.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial on 10-16-15 at 8:30 and  jury trial in Branch  47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 10-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Per defense counsel, he requested that this case be moved to 09/16/2015 at 8:30am.  Defense counsel said that his client was notified of the change of date, and will be in Court on the aforementioned time.

Defendant Andy A Olivares in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties request a Status Conference. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered the Defendant not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Court will give the Defendant until 06-12-2015 by 5:00 p.m. to turnover all firearms to the police department.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Any Carraba's Italian Grill restaurants.

Defendant Andy A Olivares in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
